item.title: 博通预测增长强劲，称人工智能支出步入正轨
item.description: 苹果公司和其他大型科技公司的芯片供应商博通公司（Broadcom Inc.【原文：Broadcom Inc., a chip supplier for Apple Inc. and other big tech companies, gave an upbeat revenue forecast, reassuring investors that spending on artificial intelligence computing remains healthy.】

item.title: 阿波罗、维斯特里亚权衡首次公开募股或出售凤凰城大学
item.description: 据知情人士透露，阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.【原文：Apollo Global Management Inc. and The Vistria Group are exploring options including a sale or initial public offering for online education company Apollo Education Group, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美联储主席沃勒尔仍认为 2025 年有可能减息两到三次
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）表示，他不支持在 3 月份降息，但认为今年还有降息两次、甚至三次的空间。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said he wouldn’t support lowering interest rates in March, but sees room to cut two, or possibly three, times this year.】

item.title: HPE 因盈利前景黯淡而下跌；将裁员 3,000 人
item.description: 惠普企业公司（Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co.【原文：Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co. plunged about 15% after providing an annual profit outlook that fell short of investor expectations and announcing plans to eliminate about 3,000 positions.】

item.title: 特朗普对人工智能发展前景的豪赌
item.description:
新一届政府重新思考了公共研究资金的问题，并让私营公司来规划未来的道路。【原文：

The new administration rethinks public funding for research, leaving it to private companies to chart the path ahead. 

】

item.title: Spotify 去年股价飙升，但势头尚未波及各大唱片公司
item.description:
Spotify 的市值已达到约 1100 亿美元。这比华纳音乐集团和环球音乐的市值总和还要多。【原文：

Spotify’s market cap has reached roughly $110 billion. That’s more than Warner Music Group and Universal Music combined.

】

item.title: 秘鲁新任财政部长寄希望于减税将经济增长率提高到 4
item.description: 秘鲁新任财政部长在上任之初就推出了一系列税收激励措施，希望将经济增长速度提高到七年来的最快水平（不包括大流行病的反弹）。【原文：Peru’s new finance minister is pushing an array of tax incentives early in his tenure in a bid to boost economic growth to its fastest pace in seven years, excluding the pandemic rebound.】

item.title: Alvogen Pharma 发放私人信用贷款以解决再融资问题
item.description: Alvogen Pharma US Inc.已安排了一笔由 Centerbridge Partners 主导的新私人贷款，这将缓解这家仿制药生产商因预计收入下降而面临的短期再融资压力。【原文：Alvogen Pharma US Inc. has arranged a new private loan led by Centerbridge Partners that will ease near-term refinancing pressure as the generic drugs maker grapples with projected revenue declines.】

item.title: 因财政问题，惠誉将哥伦比亚的前景展望降至负面
item.description: 惠誉国际评级公司（Fitch Ratings）周四将哥伦比亚的评级展望从稳定下调至负面，理由是该国财政收支状况恶化，短期内采取纠正措施的前景存疑。【原文：Fitch Ratings lowered Colombia’s rating outlook to negative from stable on Thursday, citing the deterioration of the country’s fiscal balance and doubts about prospects for corrective measures in the short term, while it affirmed the credit score at BB+.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉将把拖欠雪佛龙公司的债务再投资于当地石油工业
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普给石油巨头雪佛龙公司一个月的时间停止在这个南美国家生产石油之后，委内瑞拉将把欠雪佛龙公司的债务进行再投资。【原文：Venezuela will reinvest the debt it owes to Chevron Corp. after US President Donald Trump gave the oil giant one month to stop producing oil in the South American nation.】

item.title: 美国电网运营商因加拿大电力进口而焦头烂额
item.description: 美国东北部的电网运营商不知道如何应对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对从加拿大进口的电力征收的关税—；甚至不知道这些电力是否需要缴纳关税。【原文：Northeastern US grid operators don’t know how to deal with US President Donald Trump’s tariffs on power imported from Canada — or if the electricity is even subject to duties.】

item.title: 贝森特强调特朗普对美联储保持沉默，拒绝通胀担忧
item.description: 财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）驳斥了唐纳德-特朗普总统提高关税将引发新一轮通胀的观点，并建议美联储应将其视为一次性影响。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent rejected the idea that President Donald Trump’s tariff hikes will ignite a new wave of inflation, and suggested that the Federal Reserve ought to view them as having a one-time impact.】

item.title: Alphabet 因涉嫌言论审查收到众议院共和党传票
item.description: 共和党领导的众议院司法委员会传唤了 Alphabet 公司及其首席执行官桑达尔-皮查伊（Sundar Pichai），作为正在进行的最大科技公司与拜登政府关系调查的一部分。【原文：The Republican-led House Judiciary Committee subpoenaed Alphabet Inc. and its CEO Sundar Pichai as part of its ongoing investigation into the biggest tech companies’ relationships with the Biden administration.】

item.title: 花旗证券 97 亿美元交易收入超越巴克莱银行
item.description: Citadel Securities 公布了其有史以来最大的交易额，超过了欧洲一些最大银行的交易额，跻身世界交易巨头之列。【原文：Citadel Securities reported its largest ever trading haul, surpassing the tally at some of Europe’s biggest banks to cement itself among the world’s trading behemoths.】

item.title: OpenAI、甲骨文为星际之门网站寻找价值数十亿美元的英伟达芯片
item.description: OpenAI 和甲骨文公司（Oracle Corp. ）计划在未来几个月内开始在德克萨斯州的一个大型新数据中心内安装数万颗来自英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）的强大人工智能芯片，这是为其价值 1,000 亿美元的星际之门基础设施合资企业启动和运行首个设施所做努力的一部分。【原文：OpenAI and Oracle Corp. plan to begin filling a massive new data center in Texas with tens of thousands of powerful AI chips from Nvidia Corp. in the coming months, part of a push to get the first facility for their $100 billion Stargate infrastructure venture up and running.】

item.title: 纳斯达克 100 指数接近修正，华尔街从希望走向恐慌
item.description: 就在两周前，高歌猛进的巨型科技股及其芯片制造类股票还在推动纳斯达克 100 指数再创新高。【原文：Just two weeks ago, high-flying mega-tech stocks and their chipmaking cousins were powering the Nasdaq 100 Index to yet another record.】

item.title: 交易商前往新奥尔良，探寻并购领域的 "浩劫 "之外
item.description: 本周，交易商们聚集在新奥尔良举行的年度会议上喘息，试图寻找对 2025 年迄今为止令人失望的并购市场持乐观态度的理由。【原文：Dealmakers gathered at an annual conference in New Orleans this week to catch their breath and try to look for reasons to be optimistic about a mergers and acquisitions market that has disappointed so far in 2025.】

item.title: 新泽西学院将与州立学校合并以避免关闭
item.description: 新泽西州泽西城一所资金短缺的大学，因预算持续短缺而难以为继，准备与一所规模更大的州立学校合并。【原文：A cash-strapped college in Jersey City, New Jersey, is poised to merge with a larger state school after persistent budget shortfalls made its future unsustainable.】

item.title: 里夫斯承诺英国将进行福利改革以节省预算开支
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）表示，她将对英国的福利制度进行改革，作为政府寻求节省开支以帮助填补公共财政漏洞的努力的一部分。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said she will reform the UK’s welfare system as part of a government drive to find savings that help plug a hole in the public finances.】

item.title: 特朗普的贸易战再次引发美联储的 "短暂 "通胀问题
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统迅速演变的贸易战有可能让美联储重新面临一个再熟悉不过的问题：如果通胀走高，会是暂时的吗？【原文：President Donald Trump’s rapidly evolving trade war threatens to resurrect an all-too-familiar question for the Federal Reserve: If inflation moves higher, will it be transitory?】

item.title: 芝加哥拒绝学区为支付养老金而举债的要求
item.description: 芝加哥拒绝承担更多债务来平衡资金紧张的学校系统预算，拒绝了学区领导层周三提出的建议。【原文：Chicago refuses to take on more debt to balance the budget of its cash-strapped school system, denying a pitch district leadership floated Wednesday.】

item.title: 欧洲央行即将就是否在四月再次降息摊牌
item.description: 据熟悉欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank）官员想法的人士透露，他们正准备就下一次在 4 月份设定借贷成本时是进一步降息还是按兵不动进行艰难的谈判。【原文：European Central Bank officials are bracing for tough negotiations over whether to cut interest rates further or hold fire when they next set borrowing costs in April, according to people familiar with their thinking.】

item.title: 贝森特称美国不会在制裁俄罗斯和伊朗问题上犹豫不决
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周四表示，如果俄罗斯能源制裁有助于促成乌克兰战争停火，美国将毫不犹豫地 "全力以赴"。【原文：The US will not hesitate to go “all in” on sanctions on Russian energy if it helps lead to a cease-fire in the Ukraine war, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said Thursday.】

item.title: 美国贸易赤字创历史新高的根源--黄金进口未计入国内生产总值
item.description: 令人瞠目的进口激增使美国贸易赤字创下新高，并加剧了人们对经济的焦虑，其根源主要在于国际黄金交易商疯狂地争相将金条运往纽约的存放地。【原文：An eye-popping imports surge that has driven the US trade deficit to a record and elevated anxiety about the economy largely has its roots in a frantic scramble by international gold traders to rush bullion to New York depositories.】

item.title: 加拿大利纳马公司称关税将使汽车制造商损失数十亿美元
item.description: 加拿大第二大公共汽车零部件制造商利纳马公司（Linamar Corp.【原文：Adding steel and aluminum tariffs to auto tariffs would cost carmakers billions of dollars and is “likely to shut the industry down,” says the head of Canada’s second-largest public car parts manufacturer, Linamar Corp.】

item.title: 尼日利亚债券因油价下跌创四个月最大跌幅
item.description: 尼日利亚美元债券创下近四个月来最大跌幅，原因是投资者担心油价下跌可能会破坏政府今年的收入预期。【原文：Nigerian dollar bonds sank the most in nearly four months over investor concerns that declining oil prices could derail the government’s revenue projections for the year.】

item.title: 竞争白热化，先锋计划再推出两只债券型 ETF
item.description: Vanguard Group Inc. 继去年将其面向州和地方政府债务投资者的产品阵容扩大两倍之后，又推出了两款新的市政债券交易所交易基金产品。【原文：Vanguard Group Inc. is launching two new municipal-bond exchange-traded fund offerings after tripling its lineup of products catering to state and local-government debt investors last year.】

item.title: 从美国到德国的融资大转移
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. item.title: 欧洲发射阿丽亚娜 6 号火箭，国防领域加速发展
item.description: 欧洲阿丽亚娜6号火箭在数次推迟后于周四起飞执行首次商业任务，这有助于欧洲大陆减少对埃隆-马斯克的SpaceX公司的依赖。【原文：The European Ariane 6 rocket took off for its first commercial mission on Thursday after several delays, helping the continent’s efforts to reduce its reliance on Elon Musk’s SpaceX.】

item.title: 加拿大关注北极军事扩张以回应特朗普的要求
item.description: 加拿大正在扩大其在北极地区的军事存在，以满足特朗普政府关于增加国防开支的要求，并遏制中国和俄罗斯对这一偏远地区的影响。【原文：Canada is expanding its military presence in the Arctic region as it tries to appease the Trump administration’s calls for higher defense spending and deter Chinese and Russian influence in the remote region.】
